column1: Urban Land Institute Learning
column5: Live online & on-demand courses for purchase on real estate development, public private partnerships, pro-forma and more.

column1: What is a Form Based Code?

column5: A detailed description of Form Based Code and analysis of 4 local jurisidictions. Compares the economic data (tax revenue and rate of increased costs) for form-based and traditionally zoned developments in each city.

column1: Housing Supply Accelerator Field Guide
column5: Comprehensive guide to increasing the production of housing.

column1: Local Eviction Prevention and Policy Tool
column5: Interactive tool capturing eviction related policies for more than 400 cities.

column1: ABC's of ADUs
column5: A comprehensive explainer that includes accessible language to help gain support of ADUs, analysis of who benefits from ADUs, Model ADU configurations, and some policy guidelines for legalizing and encouraging ADU construction.

column1: Tiny Homes Resource Map

column1: Bringing the Housing Shortage into Sharper Focus

column1: Is Inclusionary Zoning Inclusionary?

column5: The report links the decline in condominium construction to defect liability laws, noting that the high cost of required insurance to guard against future lawsuits has discouraged developers.
column13: Legal reform that has the potential to unblock supply streams.

column1: Planning for Housing in a Regional Context
column5: Shows how better coordination between housing and transportation planning can enable more efficient, large-scale housing growth.
column13: Promotes smarter regional planning that supports more homes where infrastructure exists.

column1: Advancing Pro-housing Land Use Policy at the State Level
column5: Examines how states can design land-use reforms that expand housing supply.
column13: Identifies state policies that remove barriers and make it easier to build more homes.

column1: Addressing Housing Supply Challenges through Target Setting
column5: This brief presents how states and regions can set housing production targets to better align municipal decisions with regional demand and equity goals.
column13: Target-setting can catalyze more housing construction in places where it is most needed, boosting overall supply.
